#2019臺琉國際帆船賽

 6/11-6/15臺灣與日本間最大越洋賽事
→140海哩越洋距離
→30小時航程
→『石垣、基隆、越洋』共3場賽事
→超過30艘船一同在大海競技

 
大型賽事能為舉辦城市帶來龐大的經濟效益。透過舉辦帆船賽可使世界各地的帆船前來臺參賽，能夠吸引不少愛好者或是慕名而來的遊客參與其中。除了來自參與者和觀眾的收入外，部份世界知名的船賽可吸引各大贊助商及世界各地媒體的廣泛報道，從而提升主辦國的形象。
有市場研究指出，新加坡協助舉辦沃爾沃環球帆船賽，作為帆船賽的其中一站，總體收益高達4,400萬美元，其中2,700萬美元為直接經濟收入。另外，於其他國家的帆船活動的參與人數亦非常驚人，於2008-2009年，瑞典的斯德哥爾摩舉行的帆船活動，一天內到訪遊客人數達160,000名，而中國青島則有369,700名。這對於當地餐飲、酒店和其他服務，連同其他經濟收益，是十分龐大的。

 2019 TAIWAN-OKINAWA INTERNATIONAL YACHT RACE

 Taiwan and Japan’s biggest transoceanic event
From June 11th to 15th:
→ 140 nautical miles
→ 30-hour voyage
→ more than 30 yachts competing with one another
→ in total of 3 events,
『Ishigaki x Keelung x Transoceanic』

 Now, let’s get the game started!
As major sports events have the capability of bringing their host cities immense
economic benefits. hosting the yacht race may attract professional racers and
yacht enthusiasts alike to visit Taiwan. Including the potential profit that
comes within, it is a great way to promote the image of the country as well as
gaining sponsorships and media coverage from around the world.
Indicated by marketing research, yacht races promote very extensive economic
benefits. For instance, Singapore, being one of the stops in Volvo Ocean Race,
profits 27 million US dollars as direct benefits, and makes overall 44 million
US dollars in total profits. Another example includes the yacht race event in
Stockholm, Sweden; from 2008 to 2009, the event had 160,000 visitors per day
where else, Qingdao, China, had around 369,700. Lodging, dining and other
relevant industries are all within the beneficiaries of these yacht race events.

運動員生涯終有結束的一天，退役後的生活可能遭遇劇烈變化，但也可能面臨嶄新的刺激挑戰，因此運動員的職業轉換是一項相當關鍵的議題。

 
為協助運動員及奧運選手轉職及發展雙重職涯，並扶植其成為創業家，國際奧會與尤努斯中心，在阿根廷布宜諾斯艾利斯舉行的奧林匹克主義行動論壇中，簽署備忘錄，將建立「運動員365產業加速器」(Athlete365
Business
Accelerator)，透過「投入」、「培養」及「加速」3個時期，經由線上課程研習、專題研討會參與，及專家輔導等方式，協助運動員增進創業相關知能與發展個人專屬創業企畫。

 對此，IOC主席Thomas
Bach表示：「運動員是奧林匹克運動會的核心，本會持續以多樣化的方式協助運動員發展。因此，非常高興能夠與尤努斯教授與其中心合作，共同創設運動員365產業加速器，以提供運動員發展第二事業的嶄新契機。」
 

 Career transition for athletes can sometimes be a critical moment, as one’s
sports career does not last forever and daily life after competition can change
considerably. Helping athletes and Olympians with dual careers and career
transition opportunities, and empowering them to become entrepreneurs, is one of
the main focuses of the Memorandum of Understanding signed during the Olympism
In Action Forum in Buenos Aires, Argentina, between the IOC and the Yunus
Centre. During the first stage, an online course on entrepreneurship will be
available for free to all athletes around the world, accessible through the
Athlete365 platform. Subsequently, during the incubation phase, selected
athletes who have completes phase one will receive further knowledge and
mentorship on entrepreneurship through two dedicate4d rounds of workshops that
are delivered by experts and specialists in this field. Finally, in phase three,
a number of athletes, selected on the basis of their project proposals, will
receive dedicated and personalised coaching and mentorship for six months for
the execution of their project.

with wireless communication technology with AR (augmented reality technology),

運動追蹤眼鏡 穿戴新科技

 
這是一款名為「Level」的運動追蹤眼鏡，由美國眼科保健集團與南加州大學合作研發。市面上多數運動追蹤產品，都是智能手錶或手環形式，而現在也成功整合到眼鏡的領域，Level眼鏡推出後，讓大家可以輕鬆計算運動量。
Level的眼鏡柄內置了電池、藍芽和感測儀器，只要戴上就能測出步數、行走距離和卡路里消耗量，透過藍芽連接智慧型手機，數據就能清楚顯示。不過和其他穿戴式運動追蹤產品相比，Level眼鏡並沒有心率偵測，也沒有常見的來電和訊息提示，由於睡覺時都會把眼鏡摘掉，所以Level眼鏡也沒有睡眠追蹤功能。

 Level, the Wearable Technology from VSP Global
In collaboration with University of Southern California, VSP Vision Care has
developed a new pair of sports tracking glasses, Level. Unlike most sports
tracking devices on the market; they are either watches or bracelets, Level
provides an easier way to track your sports progress.
On the side of the frame, Level is equipped with the battery, bluetooth, and the
sensor. As soon as they are put on, all your steps, distance walked, and
calories burned will be synced to your phone via bluetooth. Unfortunately, the
fly in the ointment includes the lack of heart rate monitor, and incoming
call/message notifications. As most people take off their glasses when they go
to bed, Level won’t be able to track your sleep, either.

目的在結合交大加速器的科技網絡，以及培育近百個創新團隊的經驗，協助參與本計畫的運動創新團隊進行跨科技、製造與服務業的技術整合，加速鏈結HYPE所有的國際運動創新資源，及早進入國際市場，為我國運動創新帶來更多可能性。

services. The program also links participated teams with HYPE Sports Innovation
and its resources, and accelerates the process of their innovations entering the
global market. SPIN Accelerator Taiwan explores possibilities and adds more to
sports innovations in Taiwan.

and make sure you don’t miss out this time.

matching and linking of sports universities in Taiwan as well as other
well-known domestic and global businesses. For instance, some first round
applicants have been connected with businesses such as Decathlon, one of the
biggest sporting goods retailers in Europe; Giant, the leading bicycle

sportcal網站2019/7/19報導：運動反映出當今社經與環境的議題，賦予機會讓城市連結公共政策各面向目標，更是各城市塑造形象的利器。全球運動觀光市場在2019至2023年間預估成長逾36%，但運動在觀光產業中仍屬最低財務槓桿的資產。究竟城市如何透過運動賽事讓城市品牌脫穎而出，成功帶動觀光熱潮？

 1. 掌握觀光趨勢追求真實性:
目前的觀光客尋求融入當地且感性的觀光體驗，期能藉此發掘在地文化、傳統或特產。運動為城市的整體觀光體驗帶來龐大附加價值，有助城市躍升為觀光景點。

 2.了解城市特點: 惟有透過展示城市價值才能有效追求真實觀光體驗。城市可探究觀光客何以慕名而來，進而找出在地特色。

 3. 打造清楚、全面且一體適用的品牌定位:
城市品牌涉及各式各樣的利害關係人，包括在地及周邊社群與政府，因此必須建立明確且全面適用各利害關係人的品牌定位。2020東京奧運即將到來，智慧城市與運動(Smart
Cities & Sport)特與日本運動振興中心(Japan Sport’s
Council)合作舉辦特別會議，旨在呈現東京籌辦的幕後花絮。與會城市代表將能從奧林匹克視野看東京，獲得獨一無二的城市旅遊體驗。

科技體適能檢測 6分鐘讓你了解身體狀況

 教育部體育署偕同工業技術研究院、宏碁Acer等單位，提出新型態的「科技體適能檢測」，只要6分鐘就能知道自身的體適能數據，又快又精準。

 
科技體適能檢測是由宏碁完成「體育雲-全民運動資訊雲端系統」的建置；工研院則引進物聯網並實際邀請臺灣民眾進行各項國民體適能檢測作為研究基礎，訂定新型態的「科技體適能檢測」。
有別於現行的國民體適能檢測，科技體適能檢測在各項檢測項目上加入了許多科技檢測儀器。除了國民體適能檢測中的身高、體重、BMI等項目，在科技體適能中，改以身體組成分析儀器來進行檢測，透過儀器檢測軀幹與四肢之肌肉與體脂肪的比例，讓受測者更能掌握自身健康狀況。
Learn Your Physical Fitness in 6 Minutes with New Way of Testing
In collaboration with Industrial Technology Research Institute and Acer, Sports
Administration proposed a new module of ‘Technological Physical Fitness Test’;
it only takes 6 minutes but will give accurate results of your physical fitness.
Technological Physical Fitness Test is built on ‘Sports Cloud - Cloud System of
Civil Sports Data’ by Acer. Whereas, Industrial Technology Research Institute
used IoT to run the test on participants’ physical fitness; using the results,
they were able to establish a new module for ‘Technological Physical Fitness
Test’.
Contrary to some current physical fitness tests, Technological Physical Fitness
Test applies several technology devices during the examination; including the
usual testing on height, weight, BMI… etc; Technological Physical Fitness Test
also uses body composition analyzer to analyze the ratio of testees’ torso,
muscles on four limbs, and body fat - it allows they to learn about their own
health better.

 What makes Tokyo Marathon so special? How come it is the only city in Asia in
World Marathon Majors?

 The Tokyo Marathon is a sports event combined with tourism and technology. By
using the same tactic of scarcity in consumer behavior, it creates a new way of
marketing a city. “It makes people want to participate in the Tokyo Marathon
more than ever as the spots are limited“ - this subsequently makes the Tokyo
Marathon much more popular.

 In spite of its not-so-long history, the Tokyo Marathon still attracts more
than 300,000 sign-ups each year. For many participants, it’s more than just a
marathon - it’s Tokyo’s scenic views, the confetti at the start of the race, the
singing chores, music, dancing, and the folk art performance. You can also run
along with some dressed-up racers - call it a marathon but rather more like a
carnival.

 The race begins at Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building; passing through the
Tokyo Imperial Palace, Hibiya Park, Tokyo Tower, Kaminarimon, Ginza, as well as
other popular tourist attractions.

 The event brings in high tourism receipts for Tokyo. For instance, in 2014, it
generated a revenue of ¥2.87 billion JP yen - 5% from government subsidy, and
15% from the sign-up fee; including 66% of corporate sponsorship which made up
more than ¥1.8 JP yen alone.

Cycling in Kyushu Creates New Module for City Tourism
Part of Japan Sports Council’s responsibility is to establish sports policies;
on the other hand, Japan Sports Agency is in charge of organizing major sports
events in the country.
In response to the policy, cities around Japan help promote sports with their
participation, spectation, and supports.
In Kyushu, they launched a cycling website to assist cyclists in choosing where
they wish to bike to; depending on individual needs, and endurance, the website
will recommend routes based on distance as well as desired scenery. Uses have
options to bike either along the coast or with views of maple leaves; including
experiencing a route full of history and culture. Not to mention, bike rental
service is included for a more relaxing biking trip.
The website also introduces cycling competitions in the Kyushu region; cycling
enthusiasts can easily choose the events they wish to participate in.

在打造運動城市甚至主辦賽事時，協助促進基礎設施的發展。泰國觀光局表示：以運動為主題吸引遊客赴泰國，不僅可讓人因運動而開心，又能鍛鍊身體，例如喜愛跑馬拉松的人可以參加泰國最知名的曼谷夜間賽及芭達雅馬拉松賽；普吉島則以水上活動而聞名。

 
騎單車旅遊泰國，是另一種深入泰國之美的最佳方式。根據泰國自行車協會統計，在泰國6,800萬名人口中，自行車使用者約225萬人，其中約有26萬人會選擇騎自行車旅行，隨著泰國自行車休閒運動需求大增，也提高了因旅遊帶動的自行車租賃商機。

 
泰拳為泰國傳統運動，在民間相當普及，泰觀局推廣的泰拳不只是競賽訓練或觀賞泰拳比賽，現在也有不少女性遊客來學泰拳，可以讓身形線條更加漂亮，亦為推廣運動旅遊重要的項目之一。

 資料來源：經貿透視雙周刊

 The Thai Government has been actively promoting the Sports City program. In
2018, they published a Sports City index with four criteria; including promoting
fitness and basic exercise, developing sports excellence, hosting international
sports events, and promoting sports and the tourism industry.
The Thai government builds sports cities and hosts events in hopes that they can
assist the development of basic infrastructure within the country. Tourism
Authority of Thailand expressed that sports can not only attract visitors to
travel to Thailand but also encourage them to exercise. Sports are capable of
putting them in good moods. For instance, marathon racers will have the option
to sign up for the popular Bangkok Midnight Marathon or the Pattaya Marathon;
watersports enthusiasts will have other abundance to choose from in Phuket.
When it comes to touring in Thailand, cycling is another great way to explore
the beauty of the county. According to the statistics by Thailand Cycling
Association, within the 6.8 million population in Thailand, there are
approximately 2.25 million bike users, and 260,000 of them would choose to bike
on their trips. As biking has become a leisure sport in Thailand, and more and
more visitors prefer to tour the country on bikes, it has created a growth spurt
in the bike rental industry.
Muay Thai, on the other hand, is one of the first things people think about when
it comes to traditional sports in Thailand. As it is commonly practiced among
locals, Tourism Authority of Thailand tries to promote Muay Thai for more than
just training or competitions. It can also be a leisure sport activity for
anyone. Now, many female visitors would engage in Muay Thai as a means to tone
up their muscles. Without a doubt, Muay Thai is a crucial part to the promotion
of sports tourism in Thailand.

臺灣國際衝浪公開賽 打造台東海岸亮點
臺東縣政府11月底舉辦的「臺灣國際衝浪公開賽」，該賽事除了讓旅客認識臺東生態與人文之美，也成功行銷臺東金樽成為全球衝浪客嚮往造訪的衝浪勝地。
2010年台東縣政府終於從國際衝浪組織ASC爭取到列入國際衝浪巡迴賽，在東河鄉金樽漁港舉辦「台灣國際衝浪公開賽暨東浪嘉年華」，根據統計2009年來臺東遊客量為415萬人次，2013年已經升到600萬人次。
臺東在“浪”的條件上，無論大小或形狀，均可說是得天獨厚，再加上秋冬之際吹東北季風，助長東河、金樽一帶浪勢，臺東被「亞洲國際衝浪組織」(Asian Surfing
Championship, ASC)
評定為亞洲最新的國際衝浪比賽場地，成為繼馬來西亞、峇里島、泰國外，亞洲最新的最佳衝浪場地，成為臺灣唯一國際衝浪巡迴賽事場地之一。
TAIWAN OPEN OF SURFING IN TAITUNG
Organized by Taitung County Government, Taiwan Open of Surfing successfully
promotes Jinzun in Taitung as a popular surfing destination for surfers from
around the world. The event also gives visitors a chance to learn about nature
and culture in Taitung.
After a series of hard effort, Taitung city government secured a spot in the
Asian Surfing Championships in 2010, and started Taiwan Open of Surfing in
Jinzun Harbor, Taitung. According to a report, visitors to Taitung increased
from 4.15 million in 2009 to 6 million in 2013.
On top of that, Taitung may just have one of the most ideal waves for surfing.
The waves in Taitung have the right sizes and shapes, as well as the right
weather to make them perfect. During the interval of autumn and winter,
northeast monsoon occurs; which helps produce bigger and stronger waves for
surfing in Donghe and Jinzun townships. For the reasons mentioned, Taitung was
selected as the newest competition locale in the Asian Surfing Championships;
right behind Malaysia, Bali, and Thailand. Taitung became one of the latest
surfing destinations in Asia, and the only place for international surfing
events in Taiwan.
